Posts.Content: hi ladies   ADIEP RECONSTRUCTION IS MUSCLE AND SKIN THAT IS TAKEN FROM THE TUMMY AND PUT IN PLACE AS A BREAST ITS THE SMALLER OF THE OP AS THEY ARE NOT DISCONNECTING ANY MUSCLES AND THE RECOVERY IS A LOT QUICKER. A TRAM HOWEVER IS A SURGICAL CUT FROM HIP TO HIP AND ONLY FAT AND SKIN ARE MOVED ,THEY ARE TOTALLY DISCONECTED FROM THE BODY AND THEN REPLUMMED IN UNDER THE ARM TO A BLOOD VESSEL.THIS OP IS ABOUT 10 - 12 HRS LONG AND THE RECOVERY FROM WHAT I NO IS ABOUT 4 -5 MONTHS..i NO THIS TO BE FACT AS I HAVE EXPLORED EVERY AVENUE OF RECONSTRUCTION AND DECIDED ON THE TRAM WHICH I WILL BE HAVING ON 22ND JAN .HOPE THIS HELPS SHAZ
Posts.Title: ld flap Reconstruction

Posts.Content: I had grade 2 oestergeon sensitive bc in april 2013 had mx and radiotherapy. We nt back to work in jan 2014 I had a tram reconstruction all went welluntil, I got an infection and spent a week in the hospital. I was then told they had done a biopsy on my breast whilst in theatre doing the recon and it showed more cancerous cells.I now have to face chemotherapy in a couple of weeks also once my wound has healed. I had cellulitus and it ate away at the soft tissue in my breast and caused me to loose volume in my boob so after my chemo I have to have fat injections also to boost it back up again.I was told of my reoccurrence in jan and I to wont start chemo til the end of the month but they did do bone and ct scans to check if it had travelled. Might be an idea if you have not already had them to ask your oncologist for them before you start treatment to at least give you peace of mind.Not sure were you are in the country I am in Derbyshire.   Regards Sharon
Posts.Title: Vascular Invasion.... anyone had it?

Posts.Content: hi chris   I had mx in april for a 13mm lump and no chemo but had rads but only because the chest wall was not clear on the margin aspect of things.on tamoxifen for 5yrs also. I asked my surgeon and he said had they have got better margins then I would not have had anything except tamoxifen
Posts.Title: No further treatment....worried!

Posts.Content: we cope because we have no choice. hang on in there the radio naps do get better I am 8 weeks after radiotherapy and just starting to feel myself again so bear with it just take it easy. hugs x

Posts.Content: diep is that out of the back or tummy reason I ask I am facing a recon in December but not sure which one to have

Posts.Content: would love to chat either by email or phone. not sure were u are in the country I am in the midlands derbyshire
Posts.Title: Anyone need a friend

Posts.Content: I was put on tamoxifen back in april and for about 8 weeks I was crap no sleep aching in my bones but decided t say nothing n persevere and call me lucky but theyside effects have gone .I no it don't suit everone any sometimes the se are worse but try t stay positive. I obtained a copy of my pathology report and found it gave me more knowledge maybe this would be an idea I got mine from my gp

Posts.Content: were is it you live I am in derbyshire
Posts.Title: For anyone about to start or going through chemo.....

Posts.Content: I had  a  13mm lump which was quite high in my chest and also dcis in the restof my breast tissue.I could have had a lumpectomy and monitored the rest of the breasty but I decided on a mx.Not particularly pretty site only havin one breast but havin a recon nov ish time .You have all the time in the world to think about whether to av a recon or not so don't rush your decision

Posts.Title: Following Mastectomy and Reconstruction

Posts.Content: hi  I am facing the decision ld recon or tram I would love to see some photos if you are willing to share them. From what I have heard the lump under the arm is supposed to virtually disappear eventually
Posts.Title: DIEP surgery

Posts.Content: not sure if this will put your mind at rest but I had a lumpectomy in april and have a large lump feels about as big as a plum in my breast 3 months later I told my bc nurse and she said it could take months to get better so me personally would not worry to much.
Posts.Title: Advise

Posts.Content: I has a 15mm tumour that I had removed in april and was also diagnosed WITH DCIS IN THE SAME BREAST SO I OPTED FOR A MX.20 shots radio after and tamoxifen for 5 years .So I pretty much have got the same as you
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed dcis

Posts.Content: I have hert positive grade 3 bc and a recent scan showed no lymph node involvement but that scan is only a snap shot in time.i will face chemo and Herceptin as do all hert positive bc patients. I am in for a op on Friday to try to get a better clearance round the cancer and then when my infection is better I will start chemo therapy. What grade do you have do yu no
Posts.Title: Had WLE and SLNB on Thursday 27th. Get pathology results on 11th March...

Posts.Content: hi  I to have idc which was picked up on a biopsy at reconstruction stage after the year previous I had eostergeon pos bc which cost me a mx and 20 rounds radiotherapy. I thought it was alllover then this idc turned up I am having a operation on Friday to try to get clearance around it and then I will have to have chemo n Herceptin. after my reconstruction in jan I took an infection n ended up in the hospital so have been through the mill a bit myself so no exactly how you feel.whatgrade idc do you have could I ask.
Posts.Title: Had WLE and SLNB on Thursday 27th. Get pathology results on 11th March...

Posts.Content: I no you probably feel very down and scared but please please try to be a little positive this all aids your recovery seriously it does. When I was first diagnosed all I could think about was dying but I believe it is a process that are mind goes through and in time it gets better.sending u big hug x x
